claim: mile petković replace ante miše for the team slaven belupo
resp:

   1. First, we need to identify the teams where there was a change in manager. In the table, we can see that five out of seven teams (slaven belupo, istra 1961, lokomotiva, hrvatski dragovoljac and rijeka) had changes in their managers.
   2. Next, for each team with a change in manager, we need to find if the new manager replaced an existing one. In this case, we can see that slaven belupo and istra 1961 had new managers (mile petković and robert jarni respectively) who took over after the departure of their previous managers (zlatko dalić and ante miše).
   3. To verify if mile petković replaced ante miše, we need to check which team each manager was associated with at the time of their departure and where they were appointed later. In this case, ante miše was the manager for istra 1961 when he left (row index 2), while mile petković took over slaven belupo after leaving his previous position (row index 1).
   4. After checking the timeline of their departures and appointments, we can see that mile petković replaced ante miše as they both managed different teams but changed positions at around the same time.
